attributes.action: Repeal Compulsory Relationships and Sex Education (RSE) to all UK Faith schools
attributes.additional_details:
To provide support and advice to parents/carers who want to influence school policy in how RE/RSE will be taught.

To recommend points of action that people can take to mitigate the effects of the RE/RSE curriculum that are contrary to Religious teachings.
attributes.background:
To create awareness of the underlying ideologies behind the compulsory introduction of sexuality education into schools in the UK.

To campaign for and champion the rights of parents to withdraw their children from those aspects of RE/RSE that contradict their religious faith and moral beliefs.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take specific action.

You could start a new petition setting out clearly what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.
